arg.name: autoware_launch
arg.description: Whether to launch nodes for use with Autoware or not.

arg.name: imu_driver
arg.description: the namespace to use for the imu

arg.name: imu_topic
arg.description: the topic of the imu data

arg.name: filter_imu
arg.description: Use a complementary filter to fuse gyro and accelerometer data

arg.name: mag_topic
arg.description: the topic of the mag data

arg.name: use_magnetic_field_msg
arg.description: If set to true, subscribe to the /imu/mag topic as a sensor_msgs/MagneticField; if set to false (deprecated), use geometry_msgs/Vector3Stamped.

arg.name: fixed_frame
arg.description: The parent frame to be used in publish_tf. Should be set to the frame_id of the raw imu message (e.g imu_link) or base_link

arg.name: world_frame
arg.description: The world frame with respect to which the orientation is indicated (see REP-145). For historic reasons, the old default is "nwu" (North-West-Up). New deployments should use "enu". Valid values: "nwu", "enu", "ned".

arg.name: remove_gravity_vector
arg.description: If set to true, subtract the gravity vector from the acceleration field in the published IMU message.

arg.name: stateless
arg.description: If set to true, don't publish a filtered orientation. Instead, publish the stateless estimate of the orientation based on the latest accelerometer (and optionally magnetometer) readings alone. Useful for debugging.

arg.name: publish_tf
arg.description: Whether to publish a TF transform that represents the orientation of the IMU, using the frame specified in fixed_frame as the parent frame and the frame given in the input imu message as the child frame. Should be used for debugging and visualization purposes only.

arg.name: reverse_tf
arg.description: If set to true, publish transforms from imu_frame to fixed frame instead of the other way around. Should be used for debugging and visualization purposes only.
